member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.TaskHelpers.CreateTask(System.Func{System.AsyncCallback,System.Object,System.IAsyncResult},System.Action{System.IAsyncResult},System.Object)
member.summary: Create a Task based on Begin/End IAsyncResult pattern.
member.param: This parameter helps reduce allocations by passing state to the Funcs. e.g.: await TaskHelpers.CreateTask( (c, s) => ((Transaction)s).BeginCommit(c, s), (a) => ((Transaction)a.AsyncState).EndCommit(a), transaction);

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.TaskHelpers.CreateTransactionalTask(System.Transactions.Transaction,System.Func{System.AsyncCallback,System.Object,System.IAsyncResult},System.Action{System.IAsyncResult},System.Object)
member.summary: Create a Task based on Begin/End IAsyncResult pattern.
member.param: The transaction (optional) to use. If not null a TransactionScope will be used when calling the begin Func.

This parameter helps reduce allocations by passing state to the Funcs. e.g.: await TaskHelpers.CreateTask( (c, s) => ((Transaction)s).BeginCommit(c, s), (a) => ((Transaction)a.AsyncState).EndCommit(a), transaction);

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.Tracing.EventTraceActivity
member.summary: This class holds the ActivityId that would be set on the thread for ETW during the trace.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.CorrelationId
member.summary: Used in message responses and feedback Specifies the tracing correlation Id for the request; the resource provider *must* log this so that end-to-end requests can be correlated across Azure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.MessageId
member.summary: [Required for two way requests] Used to correlate two-way communication. Format: A case-sensitive string ( up to 128 char long) of ASCII 7-bit alphanumeric chars + {'-', ':', '/', '\', '.', '+', '%', '_', '#', '*', '?', '!', '(', ')', ',', '=', '@', ';', '$', '''}. Non-alphanumeric characters are from URN RFC.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.SequenceNumber
member.summary: iothub-sequencenumber A monotonically increasing identifier for each message

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.To
member.summary: [Required] Destination of the message

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.EnqueuedTime
member.summary: Time when the Message was received by the server

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.DeliveryCount
member.summary: Number of times the message has been previously delivered

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.ExpiryTime
member.summary: [Optional] The time when this message is considered expired

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.UserId
member.summary: [Required in feedback messages] Used to specify the origin of messages generated by IOT hub. Possible value: “{hub name}/”

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.Operation
member.summary: [Optional] Used to specify the role of the message in the communication pattern. Possible values: “d2c”: telemetry message (device to cloud) “c2d”: notification “d2creq”: inquiry request “d2cres”: inquiry response “c2dreq”: command request “c2dres”: command response

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.Ack
member.summary: [Optional] Used to specify the feedback required for the consumption of the message by the device. Possible values: “none”: no feedback “positive”: receive a feedback message if the message was consumed “negative”: receive a feedback message if the message expired without being completed by the device “full”: both positive and negative

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.MessageLockToken
member.summary: The lock token of the retrieved message

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.MessageLockTimeout
member.summary: Amount of time in seconds to lock message before abandoning the lock and allowing the message to be retrieved again

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.HttpAppPropertyPrefix
member.summary: Prefix for all Application property Http Headers

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.HttpIotHubName
member.summary: Internal HTTP custom headers

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.ClientIpAddress
member.summary: x-ms-client-ip-address Set to the client IP address used in the request; this is required since the resource provider will not have access to the client IP.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.PrincipalName
member.summary: x-ms-client-principal-name Set to the principal ID / UPN of the client JWT making the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.ClientTenantId
member.summary: x-ms-client-tenant-id Set to the tenant ID of the client JWT making the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.ClientAudience
member.summary: x-ms-client-audience Set to the tenant ID of the client JWT making the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.ClientIssuer
member.summary: x-ms-client-issuer Set to the issuer of the client JWT making the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.ClientObjectId
member.summary: x-ms-client-object-id Set to the object Id of the client JWT making the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.ClientAppId
member.summary: x-ms-client-app-id Set to the app Id of the client JWT making the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.ClientRequestId
member.summary: x-ms-client-request-id Caller-specified request ID, in the form of a GUID with no decoration such as curly braces (e.g. client-request-id: 9C4D50EE-2D56-4CD3-8152-34347DC9F2B0). A caller-defined value that identifies the given request. If specified, this will be included in response information as a way to map the request. If the caller provides this header – the resource provider *must* log this with their traces to facilitate tracing a single request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.ReturnClientRequestId
member.summary: x-ms-return-client-request-id Optional True or false and indicates if a client-request-id should be provided.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.ActivityId
member.summary: x-ms-activity-id The value that is used to pass activityID in REST API between services

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.ApiVersion
member.summary: api-version Specifies the version of the protocol used to make this request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.MicrosoftAsyncOperationHeaderName
member.summary: Azure-AsyncOperation Set to the URL where the result of the long running operation can be checked; to optionally be used in addition to the Location header.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Common.WebApi.CustomHeaderConstants.RequestId
member.summary: x-ms-request-id A unique identifier for the current operation, service generated. All the resource providers *must* return this value in the response headers to facilitate debugging.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.JobProperties.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor that creates an empty JobProperties object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.JobProperties.JobId
member.summary: System generated. Ignored at creation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.JobProperties.StartTimeUtc
member.summary: System generated. Ignored at creation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.JobProperties.EndTimeUtc
member.summary: System generated. Ignored at creation. Represents the time the job stopped processing.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.JobProperties.Type
member.summary: Required. The type of job to execute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.JobProperties.Status
member.summary: System generated. Ignored at creation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.JobProperties.Progress
member.summary: System generated. Ignored at creation. Represents the percentage of completion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.JobProperties.InputBlobContainerUri
member.summary: URI containing SAS token to a blob container that contains registry data to sync.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.JobProperties.InputBlobName
member.summary: The blob name to be used when importing from the provided input blob container.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.JobProperties.OutputBlobContainerUri
member.summary: URI containing SAS token to a blob container. This is used to output the status of the job and the results.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.JobProperties.OutputBlobName
member.summary: The name of the blob that will be created in the provided output blob container. This blob will contain the exported device registry information for the IoT Hub.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.JobProperties.ExcludeKeysInExport
member.summary: Optional for export jobs; ignored for other jobs. Default: false. If false, authorization keys are included in export output. Keys are exported as null otherwise.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.JobProperties.FailureReason
member.summary: System genereated. Ignored at creation. If status == failure, this represents a string containing the reason.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.JobStatus
member.summary: Specifies the various job status for a job.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.JobType
member.summary: Used to delineate job actions.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message
member.summary: The data structure represent the message that is used for interacting with IotHub.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor with no body data

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Constructor which uses the argument stream as the body stream.
member.param: a stream which will be used as body stream.
member.remarks: User is expected to own the disposing of the stream when using this constructor.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Constructor which uses the input byte array as the body
member.param: a byte array which will be used to form the body stream
member.remarks: user should treat the input byte array as immutable when sending the message.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.#ctor(Microsoft.Azure.Amqp.AmqpMessage)
member.summary: This constructor is only used in the receive path from Amqp path, or in Cloning from a Message that has serialized.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This constructor is only used on the Gateway http path so that we can clean up the stream.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.MessageId
member.summary: [Required for two way requests] Used to correlate two-way communication. Format: A case-sensitive string ( up to 128 char long) of ASCII 7-bit alphanumeric chars + {'-', ':', '/', '\', '.', '+', '%', '_', '#', '*', '?', '!', '(', ')', ',', '=', '@', ';', '$', '''}. Non-alphanumeric characters are from URN RFC.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.To
member.summary: [Required] Destination of the message

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.ExpiryTimeUtc
member.summary: [Optional] The time when this message is considered expired

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.CorrelationId
member.summary: Used in message responses and feedback

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.Ack
member.summary: Indicates whether consumption or expiration of the message should post data to the feedback queue

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.LockToken
member.summary: [Required] LockToken of the received message

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.EnqueuedTimeUtc
member.summary: Time when the message was received by the server

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.UserId
member.summary: [Required in feedback messages] Used to specify the origin of messages generated by device hub. Possible value: “{hub name}/”

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.Properties
member.summary: Gets the dictionary of user properties which are set when user send the data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.SystemProperties
member.summary: Gets the dictionary of system properties which are managed internally.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.DeliveryTag
member.summary: Gets or sets the deliveryTag which is used for server side checkpointing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.Clone
member.summary: Makes a clone of the current event data instance.
member.exception: throws if the event data has already been disposed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the current event data instance

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.GetBodyStream
member.summary: Return the body stream of the current event data instance
member.exception: throws if the method has been called.
throws if the event data has already been disposed.
member.remarks: This method can only be called once and afterwards method will throw .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Message.GetBytes
member.summary: This methods return the body stream as a byte array
member.exception: throws if the method has been called.
throws if the event data has already been disposed.
